format: A data frame with 10,000 observations on the following 55 variables.

parameters.emp_length:
Number of years in the job, rounded down.
If longer than 10 years, then this is represented by the value
10.
parameters.num_active_debit_accounts:
Number of currently
active bank cards.
parameters.months_since_last_credit_inquiry:
Number of months
since the last credit inquiry on this applicant.
parameters.open_credit_lines:
Number of currently open lines
of credit.
parameters.accounts_opened_24m:
Number of new lines of credit
opened in the last 24 months.
parameters.account_never_delinq_percent:
Percent of all lines
of credit where the applicant was never delinquent.
parameters.debt_to_income_joint:
Debt-to-income ratio for the
two parties.
parameters.num_cc_carrying_balance:
Number of credit cards
that are carrying a balance.
parameters.initial_listing_status:
Initial listing status
of the loan. (I think this has to do with whether the
lender provided the entire loan or if the loan is across
multiple lenders.)
parameters.earliest_credit_line:
Year of the applicant's
earliest line of credit
parameters.total_credit_lines:
Total number of credit lines
in this applicant's credit history.
parameters.installment:
Monthly payment for the loan the
applicant received.
parameters.delinq_2y:
Delinquencies on lines of credit in the
last 2 years.
parameters.paid_total:
Total that has been paid on the loan by the
applicant.
parameters.total_collection_amount_ever:
The total amount
that the applicant has had against them in collections.
parameters.current_accounts_delinq:
Number of accounts where
the applicant is currently delinquent.
parameters.paid_interest:
The amount of interest paid so far by the
applicant.
parameters.term:
The number of months of the loan
the applicant received.
parameters.months_since_90d_late:
Months since the last time
the applicant was 90 days late on a payment.
parameters.num_historical_failed_to_pay:
The number of
derogatory public records, which roughly means the
number of times the applicant failed to pay.
parameters.verified_income:
Type of verification
of the applicant's income.
parameters.total_credit_limit:
Total available credit, e.g.
if only credit cards, then the total of all the credit limits.
This excludes a mortgage.
parameters.current_installment_accounts:
Number of installment
accounts, which are (roughly) accounts with a fixed payment
amount and period. A typical example might be a 36-month
car loan.
parameters.num_open_cc_accounts:
Total number of currently
open credit card accounts.
parameters.total_debit_limit: Total of all bank card limits.
parameters.num_accounts_120d_past_due:
Number of current
accounts that are 120 days past due.
parameters.homeownership:
The ownership status of the
applicant's residence.
parameters.inquiries_last_12m:
Inquiries into the applicant's
credit during the last 12 months.
parameters.verification_income_joint:
Type of verification of
the joint income.
parameters.paid_late_fees: Late fees paid by the applicant.
parameters.interest_rate:
Interest rate of the loan
the applicant received.
parameters.num_total_cc_accounts:
Total number of credit card
accounts in the applicant's history.
parameters.loan_amount:
The amount of the loan the
applicant received.
parameters.num_collections_last_12m:
Number of collections
in the last 12 months. This excludes medical collections.
parameters.loan_purpose:
The category for the purpose
of the loan.
parameters.paid_principal:
The difference between the original loan
amount and the current balance on the loan.
parameters.annual_income_joint:
If this is a joint application,
then the annual income of the two parties applying.
parameters.total_credit_utilized:
Total credit balance,
excluding a mortgage.
parameters.num_accounts_30d_past_due:
Number of current
accounts that are 30 days past due.
parameters.application_type:
The type of application: either
individual or joint.
parameters.public_record_bankrupt:
Number of bankruptcies
listed in the public record for this applicant.
parameters.sub_grade: Detailed grade associated with the loan.

title: Loan data from Lending Club
description:
Description
This dataset represents thousands of loans made through the Lending Club
platform, which is a platform that allows individuals to lend to other
individuals. Of course, not all loans are created equal. Someone who is a
essentially a sure bet to pay back a loan will have an easier time getting a
loan with a low interest rate than someone who appears to be riskier. And
for people who are very risky? They may not even get a loan offer, or they
may not have accepted the loan offer due to a high interest rate. It is
important to keep that last part in mind, since this dataset only
represents loans actually made, i.e. do not mistake this data for loan
applications!
reference:
This data comes from Lending Club
(https://www.lendingclub.com/info/statistics.action), which
provides a very large, open set of data on the people who received loans
through their platform.
